original: MALMING, Berndt Gustav Sixten R :son, Grosshandlare, Sävedalen, f Lugnas, Skarab l, 29/7 83 av lantbr B R Persson o Charlotta Svensson, ogift. Hal, Schartaus, hdlsinst i Hamburg, hdlshögsk i London, Alliance Fran-gaise i Paris, prakt i Sv o utl. Anst ss utl korresp, kont.ch o dir.assist i olika fmor o h 23 SvRKis hjälpkté f krigsfångar i Sthlm. Grund eg export- o imp.rörelse, fma Sixten Malming samt Svecia pälsfarin, inneh fma Sixten Malming o Västsvenska Egendomsbyrån i Sävedalen. Förste odlaren av sydamrik nutria o kanadensisk fiskmård i Sv, en av pionjärerna f silverrävsuppfödn här. Rev i fi bolag. Av trycket: Stambok f silverräv, niedarb i sv, eng o amerik facktidskr, översatt »Silver-rävsaveln, dess hist o plats i hdln o silverräven som husdjur». Resor: Norge, Danm, Ital, Span, Engl, Frankr, Skottl, USA, Canada. En av grund av frn Mercuri-Schartauanerna. TRK:s ftJM. Hobbies: Litteratur, friluftsliv, fiske, jaktvård.
translated: MALMING, Berndt Gustav Sixten R :son, Wholesale Trader, Sävedalen, born in Lugnas, Skarab l, on July 29, 1883, to farmer B R Persson and Charlotta Svensson, unmarried. Education: Schartaus Commercial Institute in Hamburg, Business School in London, Alliance Fran-gaise in Paris, practical experience in Sweden and abroad. Employed as a foreign correspondent, accounting clerk, and director's assistant in various companies, and from 1923 worked at the Swedish Red Cross aiding war prisoners in Stockholm. Founded an export and import business, named the Sixten Malming Company, as well as Svecia Fur Farming, which is owned by Sixten Malming and Västsvenska Egendomsbyrån in Sävedalen. Among the first breeders of South American nutria and Canadian mink in Sweden, and one of the pioneers in silver fox farming. Served in the army. Publications: Registry for silver fox, contributions in Swedish, English, and American trade journals, translated "Silver Fox Breeding, its history and place in commerce, and the silver fox as a domestic animal." Traveled to Norway, Denmark, Italy, Spain, England, France, Scotland, USA, and Canada. One of the founding members of the Mercuri-Schartauans. Member of the Royal Hunting Association. Hobbies: Literature, outdoor activities, fishing, game management.
